TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ServerInfo extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides information about the SharePoint Foundation server where a form is located.

remarks.para: If the form template was published to a SharePoint Foundation server, the members of the class can be used to determine information about where the form is published, such as the URL of the document library where the form is located. To access the object associated with the current form, use the property of the class.

In a managed code form template created using the object model provided by the members of the namespace, you can use the this (C#) or Me (Visual Basic) keyword in your form code to access the members of the class directly (without requiring an object variable that establishes a reference to the class).

For example, the following code example uses the this or Me keyword to access the object associated with the current form, and then uses the property to create a string variable that contains the URL of the document library where the form is located.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed
Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property SharePointListUrl As Uri
public: abstract property Uri ^ SharePointListUrl { Uri ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a that provides the URL of the document library where the form is located.
Docs.value: The URL of the document library.

remarks.para: This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.

remarks.para: This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
